Rotation of a Point along an Arc

The task is to rotate a point along an arc described by an angle . In order to do that, we express the point in polar coordinates:

Then, rotating by angle in the trigonometric sense (counter-clockwise) will change the angle and leave unchanged giving us the new point , where:
